pkgmetadata.longdescription: Parametric Mortality Models, Life Tables and HMD // Fit the most popular human mortality 'laws', and construct full and abridge life tables given various input indices. A mortality law is a parametric function that describes the dying-out process of individuals in a population during a significant portion of their life spans. For a comprehensive review of the most important mortality laws see Tabeau (2001) doi:10.1007/0-306-47562-6_1. Practical functions for downloading data from various human mortality databases are provided as well.
